lines.text: [Narrating first lines]
Listen, here's the thing. If you can't spot the sucker in your first half hour at the table, then you ARE the sucker.

[Narrating]
In "Confessions of a Winning Poker Player," Jack King said, "Few players recall big pots they have won, strange as it seems, but every player can remember with remarkable accuracy the outstanding tough beats of his career." It seems true to me, cause walking in here, I can hardly remember how I built my bankroll, but I can't stop thinking of how I lost it.
If you had it to do all over again, knowing what would happen, would you make the same choice?

[Smiling]
what choice?

[Referring to Mike]
He beat me... Straight up... Pay him... Pay that man his money.
She's really got him by the balls.
That's not so bad, is it?
It depends on the grip!
Uh, you know what? I got my five grand here. That's just fine by me. I'm going home.
Fine. It's a fucking joke anyway. After all, I am paying you with your money.
What did you say?
Your money... I am still up 20 grand... from this last time I stick it in you.

[Narrating]
They're trying to goad me, trying to own me. But this isn't a gunfight. It's not about pride or ego. It's only about money. I can leave now, even with Grama and KGB... and halfway to paying Petrovsky back. That's the safe play. I told Worm you can't lose what you don't put in the middle. But you can't win much either.
In my club, I will splash the pot whenever the fuck I please.

[Narrating a quote from a gambling maxim]
You can shear a sheep many times, but skin him only once.

You were lookin' for that third three, but you forgot that Professor Green folded on Fourth Street and now you're representing that you have it. The DA made his two pair, but he knows they're no good. Judge Kaplan was trying to squeeze out a diamond flush but he came up short and Mr. Eisen is futilely hoping that his queens are going to stand up. So like I said, the Dean's bet is $20.
Enough is enough, Teddy. Finish the fucking kid off.
Hanging around, hanging around. Kid's got alligator blood. Can't get rid of him.

[Narrating]
I've often seen these people, these squares at the table, short stack and long odds against them. All their outs gone. One last card in the deck that can help them. I used to wonder how they could let themselves get into such bad shape, and how the hell they thought they could turn it around.
Why do you think the same five guys make it to the final table of the World Series of Poker EVERY YEAR? What, are they the luckiest guys in Las Vegas?
Now, what did I ever do to that guy?
You fucked his mother.

I never told anybody this, about eight nine months ago, I'm at the Taj it's late and I see Johnny Chan walk in and he goes and sits in the three hundred six hundred section and the whole place stops and everybody puts an eye on him, after a while there wasn't a crap going on because all the high rollers are over there watching and some of them playing but they're giving their money to him and say "oh", I played with the world champion", you know what I did?
What?
I sat down
You need fifty to sixty grand to play right in that game
I had six but I had to know
what happened?
Played tight for an hour, folded mostly then I made a score
With what? aces or kings?
Rags, I had nothing, but he raised and I decided I don't care about the money, I'm just going to out play the guy, I'm going to out play this guy, this hand, I'll re-raise
Re-raise? You play right back at him?

Yeah, he comes back over the top at me trying bully me like I'm some tourist, I hesitate for like two seconds then I'll re-raise and he makes a move to his checks and he looks at me, check his cards and looks at me again, and he mucked it, I took it down

[Flash back narrates Johnny Chan]
did you have it?

[Flash back narrates]
I'm sorry John, I don't remember
I got up and walked to the cashier, I sat with the best in the world, and I won
You made a fucking move on Chan you son of a bitch, so that's why you made that run at KGB's place
That's right I'll do it again if I can
[Narrating last lines]
First prize at the World Series of Poker is a million bucks. Does it have my name on it? I don't know. But, I'm gonna find out.
[Mike's girlfriend has just left him over his broken promise not to play poker]
You know what always cheers me up?
No, what's that?

Rolled up aces over kings. Check-raising stupid tourists and taking huge pots off of them. Playing all-night high-limit Hold'em at the Taj, "where the sand turns to gold." Stacks and towers of checks I can't even see over.
Fuck it, let's go.
Don't tease me.
Let's play some cards.
Yes!
Throw away your cards the moment you know they can't win. Fold the fucking hand.
Lays down a monster. The fuck did you lay that down?
Nyet! Nyet! No More! No! Not tonight! This son of bitch, all night he, "Check. Check. Check." He trap me!

[Narrating]
I want him to think that I am pondering a call, but all I'm really thinkin about it Vegas and the fuckin' Mirage.
Like my uncle Les used to say "When the money is gone, it's time to move on". So enjoy it, you secret handshaking assholes.
You comin' up?
No, I've been standin' out here all this time just to say hi.
All right, listen, things haven't been that smooth on the homefront so, you know, tone it down a little, all right?
Tone done what, motherfucker?
That's 4,400. I'm gonna call you. Or else, I won't respect myself tomorrow morning.
Respect is all you have left in the morning!
Hey, lemme ask you a question. In the legal sense, can fuckin' Steinbrenner move the Yankees? Does he have the fuckin' right to just move them?
How should I know that?
You didn't learn that yet?
No, we get to Steinbrenner in third year law school.
Oh...
It hurts doesn't it? Your hopes dashed, your dreams down the toilet. And your fate is sitting right besides you.
I guess the sayings' true. In the poker game of life, women are the rake man. They are the fuckin' rake.
What the fuck are you talkin' about. What saying?
I-I don't know. There ought to be one though.

[Narrating]
The game is no limit hold 'em. The Cadillac of poker.
Are you satisfied now, Teddy? Because I can keep busting you up all night if you like.
Aces full, Mike.
That ace could not have helped you.
[drops all of his chips onto the table]
I bet it all.

[laughs]
You're right Teddy, the ace didn't help.
[pushes chips towards the center and flops down his cards]
I flopped the nut straight.
What kind of a job is that going to be, Mike um, writing an opinion on high stakes poker?
Hon, you're the one that told me I should use my poker skills in the court room.
Mr. Son of a bitch, let's play some cards!
What happened?
Nothing, she closed her legs too fast!
we cant run from who we are, our destiny chooses us.
Would you stop fucking around, for five goddamn minutes for once in your fucking life?
Whoa, Jesus, what happened? My old man just walked in.
[His girlfriend says they don't have time for sex now]
I'll be really quick. You won't feel a thing.
Where did you come up with the scratch for that? You've been rolling fags in the Village again, haven't you?
What did you think he had? Does he look like a man beaten by jacks?
Jacks are a monster compared to the crap you've played
Fuuc you... fuck you...
Fuck Me? Fuck You!

[after Mike raises in the very first game against Teddy]
That's a position raise, I call.
Want a cookie?

[Narrating]
It's immoral to let a sucker keep his money.

[Narrating]
It's like the nature channel... you don't see Piranhas eating themselves, do you?
You wanna see the seventh card, stop speaking fucking sputnik! I'm sure you guys were talking about pirogies and snow but let's cut that out.
I'm listening. What do you need? 500? A grand?
Huh? I need... I need 15,000.
Fifteen?
Yep.
I need a blow job from Christy Turlington. Get the fuck outta here. $15,000?
You're in trouble?
Yes sir, I am, not with the law, I owe
Gambling debt?
Yes, it's not mine, I vouched for the wrong guy, now it's on me
I understand, what will it take to be free of this?
I need fifteen thousand tonight
I'm not a wealthy man
I know, it kills me to ask you this, I don't have any other play, if you can help me at all
I hate to see you like this and I want to help you, if it must be tonight, ten is the best I can do
Will you do that?
Yes
[writes a check]
so you take this money and get yourself out of this trouble, you hear me?
I promise I'll pay you back

[nods]
I know good luck
You owe twenty five I'll take the rest in five days

Five grand a week and you keep the juice going we want what you want we want to square this thing but three days is impossible no one's saying "your not the man", just think of it as a business decision, he just got out let's put him on a plan
This is not the money store we're no negotiating I tell you how it works
Then I'm asking

[to Worm]
you looking for some charity?
I need your fucking charity like I need your cock in my ass
Will you shut the fuck up?
It's too late for him to shut the fuck up
His good for it
If you think his good for it then it's on you too
Then it's on me too
Fifteen large five days or I start breaking things
It's plenty wise we know what we're holding and we know what you're holding
The fuck you know what we all got
Summer clerkship in your office says I know what your holding
I wouldn't bet with a job like that let's just say "I'll put you at the top of the list" if your right
What the fuck were you thinking?
I was trying to give us an edge
I had them
Look I'm sorry we got banged up, I took a shot and missed, it happens
Happens all the time around you
And it doesn't happen to you? You're the one that flushed his whole bank roll on one hand
Oh fuck you man, that was different
How is that different? What makes you so fucking special? Why are all your moves so smart and noble and I'm always the idiot piece of shit? You act like you're only one with any ambition
Then what's your ambition? I don't know, you tell me
I don't know, I don't think like that
No, you don't think
No, I don't think like you, you always think you can beat the game straight up, that's not me, and I'm always going to look for that edge, always
Alright, what's the edge now? We owe fifteen grand in a day and we're broke, what the fuck do we do?
That's easy, we get the fuck outta dodge

[while base dealing]
Who wants more? I'm in, I'm staging a late night comeback, a "late night rally", just to warn you

[Grabs Worm's hand]
Hold on there
What are you doing?
Give me the deck
Relax don't get so agitated
Looks like we got a rogue game here
A what?
What the hell is going on over here?

[Referring to Worm]
This son of a bitch is base dealing, I caught a hanger
A "hanger"? What are you saying? I don't even know what you're saying
His saying you're dealing off the bottom of the deck
Come on guys

[Referring to Mike]
What'd he give him?
Seven of hearts

[to Mike and Worm]
You boys working? Are you professionals?
No listen I was winning before this guy got here
Let the cards do the talking, if the seven didn't help you we'll listen to what you have to say

[Ozzie turns mike's cards over]
hey, three of a kind you've Ozzie three sixes like...
SHUT UP

[Vitter gives him the deck of cards and he shows the ace of spades on the bottom]
One last thing

[All the state troopers stand up]
Alright take it easy are you going to read us our rights at least?
What can you do for me? I mean five hundred isn't even enough to get me started
Five hundred won't help, what's two grand going to do?
Five hundred won't help, what's two grand going to do? What kind of trouble you in?
With the worst kind, with the worst guy
KGB?
Yeah
Didn't I tell you? Never let that guy ahold of you?
You told me a lot of things

Yeah I did, and you don't listen, I tell you to play within your means, you risk your whole bank roll, I tell you not to over extend yourself, to rebuild, so you don't have to hock for more, I was giving you a living, showing you the playbook I put together off my beats and that wasn't enough for you
This is the one time I don't need you to tell me how I fucked up, I know I fucked up, what I need from you is money, I need whatever money you can give me
That's the thing, this time there is no money, I give you two grand what's that buy you? A day? No I give it to you I'm wasting it
That's fucking great
You did it to yourself, you had to put it all on the line for some Vegas pipe dream
I took a risk, I took a risk, you see all the angles, and you never have the fucking stones to play one

Stones? you little punk, I'm not playing for the thrill of fucking victory here, I owe rent, alimony, child support, I play for money, my kids eat, I got stones enough not to chase card actions of fucking pipe dreams of winning the world series on ESPN, but about the money I've got to turn my back, I've got to say no
That's fine I understand

[In bar]
Mind if I sit?
Please, have a seat
That was a nifty trick the other night
Thank you
Marinacci and the DA were ready to cut cards for your services, of course it was altogether a different trick you pulled today, the disappearing act at your meeting.
Yeah, I figured I owe you an explanation.
No, not to me, I'm sure there was a good reason you left, you just have to work harder, prepare and smooth things out with the others, I'm sure there was a good reason why you left.
[nods]
Where's your friend?
His gone
So you brought my money?
I'm a little short
How short?
The whole way
There must be some kind of story
As you can see I can't pay you
I can see you're banged up pretty good, you never should've vouched for that scumbag
Maybe not
You're leaving me no outs here
Why?
I can't trust that you're not playing me
I'm not the one working with a partner
You want to take it up with KGB you go right ahead otherwise you got one day
"three stacks of high society"

[Narrating]
Doyle Brunson says" the key to no limit is to put a man to a decision for all his chips" Teddy's just did it his representing aces the only hand better than my cowboys I can't call and just give him a chance to catch I can only fold if I believe him in a heads up match your stack is almost as important as the quality of your cards I chopped one of his legs off in the first hand now all I have to do is lean on him until he falls over

if you spot a man's tell, you don't say a fucking word I finally spotted KGB's and usually I'd let him chewing those Oreos until he was dead broke but I don't have that kind of time I've only got until morning not even Teddy KGB is immune to getting a little rattled

[to Mike after Worm was released from prison]
You've got to understand there's two economies in there, there's cash and there's trade, so I've got to keep three games going at once, a game with the white guys, a game with the brothers and a game with the guards, the trick is I've got to skim enough cash off the white guys so I can lose it to the guards so they can keep doing me favors and then I've got to trim enough smokes off the brothers so I can trade and keep living in the "style" I've grown accustomed to and I've got to do all of this without getting my ass kicked.
I know a magician doesn't reveal his secrets
I'm not a magician
If it wasn't "magic", how did you know what everyone held?
I was watching when the cards came out, that's just an old habit with me, it's like breathing
Watch the cards?

I watch the cards but I also watch the player react to the cards. That's how I knew the DA made his two pair and judge Kaplan missed the flush, I was watching their eyes when they checked their river cards, their faces tell you everything

[Confused]
you watch the man? I never knew you had to calculate so much in cards

here's some advice, just play premium hands, you only start with jacks or better if its good enough to call you've also got to be in there raising, tight but aggressive and I do mean aggressive, you've got to think of it as a war

[Jokingly]
you're officially never invited to our game again
I don't blame you, put a guy like me in that game, cards don't even matter I'll play it blind

I know this girl Barbra I was so close to banging her before I went away, she works as a hostess for all the trust fund babies in there, she got me in their game, she introduces me as her "cousin" from out of town who loves to gamble and wants to win at poker.
It sounds solid, that's a nice hook up
It's all the way nice, but I got this "feeling".
What "feeling" is that exactly?
You know this "feeling", I got the table all set, knife, fork, sauce...

[Implying Worm doesn't have money to buy into this game]
You just don't have the "steak"
Exactly

[Giving Worm money]
here's two twenty, that'll get you started
Two twenty? Thanks but that's like eleven bets I can't even get a table in here.
Then forget this game I'll straighten you out in the city tomorrow.
I'm already behind here.
You just got out, what's the big fucking hurry?
The hurry is other than you, there are five guys eagerly waiting my release.
How much do you owe?
Like ten.
Ten?
I can't even figure it out with the juice. I can get started on this easy if it's you and me working together.
I heard you asking me before and I hear you asking now but I can't do that, I just can't do that, I've made promises.
I totally understand, its fine. I'll just make a couple moves earlier than I would've before.
You have a respectable profession
Not to my family my parents were devastated, destroyed by my decision my father sent me away to New York to live with distant cousins I eventually found my place, my life's work
What then?
I amerced myself fully, I studied everything I could about the law I felt deeply inside that it was what I was born to do
Did your parents get over it?
No, I always hoped that I would find some way to change their mind, but they were inconsolable, my father never spoke to me again

[Narrating]
Worm's dad did the grounds, when he wasn't too fucking drunk, that's when we did them, of course the grounds weren't all we did, Worm put us into a scam a day on all the young aristocrats we went to school with, selling them dime bags of Oregano, nunchakus, or fire crackers from Chinatown, kept us in lunch money until the time we went from more than just pocket change and got caught we had the starting five take a dive against Friends Academy the point guard snapped and gave Worm up, they hauled him before the school board and offered him a deal " tell us who else was involved and we'll go easy on you" Worm didn't say a fucking word and got himself expelled, I stayed in school and graduated, not many friends can stand up for a friend like that.

[referring to making money by playing cards]
have you been working? Is your game sharp?
No, I'm off it
You're getting cold cards?
No I quit
What, are you shitting me?
I got cleaned out
Mike McDe, you lost?
It was a real blood game over at KGB's place
You sat down with the mad Russian and he emptied your pockets?
Yeah I didn't want to tell you while you were in prison, I didn't want to dispirit you.
So you're just a student now? What are doing for money?
I'm driving Knish's truck
Oh my God, you're killing me, we've got to get you back in the game we're old partners, we're going to "run it" like we always did.
No, I'm off it I really am, I'm done.

[Narrating at the judge's game]
The amazing thing is, in this collection of great legal minds there isn't a single real card player.

[Using Petrovsky's money to play for him and narrating]
I don't know if I'm going to bring my legal career to a crashing halt before it even starts but sometimes I just can't help myself.
Knish. How are you?
The same.

[Narrating and entering KGB's underground gambling parlor]
just walking in here makes me queasy, the brick walls, the fucking mopes at the table, the musty smell, I feel like Buckner walking back into Shea, but what choice do I have?
If you don't have my money then you are mine.
Let's start the hurley.
Hey, I'm not gonna let a garbage can fall on my head.
No, you're gonna jump out of the way and let it land on me.

For generations, the men of my family have been rabbis in Israel before that in Europe, it was to be my calling. I was quite a prodigy. I was the "pride" of my Yeshiva. The elders said I had a forty year old understanding of the Midrash. By the time I was twelve by the time I was thirteen I knew I could never be a rabbi.
Why not?
Because for all I understood of the Talmud, I never saw God there.
